I am not sure how...or if...I'll really answer any of my own concerns, but it will be a game I'd like to play and will fit my own ideas of what makes neat sci-fi from Space hulk, to Aliens, and hopefully beyond.

99204.name: Hill Cantons Compendium
99204.description:
subtitle:
Being a Collection of Player Options and House Rules Various and Sundry for Classic Fantasy Role-playing Games Old and Dear

excerpts from the designer's blog:
...a small horde of house rules, player options, variant classes and other crunchy bits from the last two years of play in the Hill Cantons in two cities (and a few countries if you count in my co-conspirators Skype games from Dragonsfoot). ... I compiled these various bits into a working document called the Hill Cantons Compendium.

Although a good chunk of the main section is likely only of interest to players in the campaign, the appendixes--most notably the three new variant classes for Labyrinth Lord and it's Advanced Edition book-- may be of greater interest to you the faceless hordes of the Internet.

user comment:
Classes introduced are the Mountebank, the White Wizard and the Feral Dwarf. Other options are presented for combat and character creation, along with a few odds and ends of house rules.

99205.name: Jumpman Junior
99205.description:
User Summary:

Jumpman Junior is a sequel to Epyx's original Jumpman, published for the Commodore 64, Atari 400/800, and ColecoVision. Jumpman Junior has 12 distinct levels, some of which are original creations for the sequel, and some of which are derived from levels in Jumpman.

99206.name: Monster Lab
99206.description:
From the back of the box:

Will you create the ultimate monster?

Perform outrageous experiments to build your very own mad monsters! Face creepy quests and challenges in the eerie Uncanny Valley and pitch your ultimate creations in fierce combat against the super-evil Baron and his grotesque army of monsters.

99207.description:
A 5th Martian Coaster with black squares and gray arrows is a special promo card that allows for a 5 player game of the Looney Labs game.

Martian Coasters is an Icehouse game playable with a single Treehouse set, a set of Martian Coasters (each with a colored 3x3 maze printed on it), and a standard d6.

The coasters are arranged in a square and the pieces are placed on differently-colored coasters.

The objective is to move the pieces of your color through the maze printed on the coasters and onto a goal square at the center of your coaster.

The game additionally makes use of the Treehouse die, allowing the players to reorient and move the coasters, creating a constantly changing maze.
99207.name: 5th Martian Coaster

99208.name: Karate Fighters
99208.description:
In this 1 on 1 fighting game, each player controls a "karate fighter" using a spinning dial that makes the fighter throw kicks and punches. The object is to kick your opponent in the chest hard enough to make him fly off the base. The electronic version would let out a blood-curdling scream when a fighter would fly off. Considered to be the "Rock'em Sock'em robots" of the 90's, Karate Fighters took the fighting genre to a new level. Imagine the video game "Mortal Kombat" brought to life.

Several Editions were released:
Red Ninja Vs. Dragon Kick
Samurai Ninja Vs. Headstone - Electronic
Tiger Ninja Vs. Cyberfist - Electronic
Razorjaw Vs. Sun Warrior
Serpent Strike Vs. The Iron Claw
Thunderfoot Vs. Skull Crusher
Kick Star Vs. Corporal Punishment

Other Playable Ninjas Sold Separately via Mail in Offer:
The Dark Ninja
Silver Sword

4 Player Combat Arena
Rex Havoc Vs. The Tattoo Terror

Alternate Editions:
Batman Vs. The Joker
GI:Joe: Duke Vs. Neo Viper
Transformers: Optimus Prime Vs. Megatron
Small Soldiers: Chip Hazard Vs. Archer

99209.name: 30 Character Motivations
99209.description:
From the publisher:

Adamant Entertainment, the first Pathfinder support publisher, presents this optional addition to the creation process for your Pathfinder Characters: 30 Character Motivations.

Character Motivations are strong personality traits or passions which represent beliefs or ideals that shape a character’s actions and behavior. Motivations find their way into almost every aspect of a character’s life and can occasionally be difficult to control.

In some ways, Character Motivations are similar to Character Traits. In fact, Traits and Motivations can be used in tandem to create well realized character backgrounds. One important distinction between Traits and Character Motivations, however, is that Character Motivations tend to be a much more integral part of the character than Traits normally are, and subsequently convey considerably larger benefits. Character Motivations can easily dominate most facets of a character’s personality and typically require a heavier role-playing commitment from the player.

This PDF features 15 pairs of opposed Motivations, and full rules for their use in your Pathfinder campaigns.

99210.name: La Abadía del Crimen
99210.description:
This is a Spanish videogame based on Umberto Eco's "The name of the rose".

From the game description:

A Franciscan monk, Guillermo de Occam, accused of heresy by the Inquisition, goes to an important Italian abbey to have an interview with the Pope's representative, Bernardo Güi, to try to solve their differences.

While staying in the abbey, Guillermo and his novice Adzo witness some strange events. Guillermo, being one of the most brilliant minds of the continent, is invited to try to solve the mysterious crimes that seem to be linked to a mysterious book.

99211.name: Pages of Lore (Issue 14 - Sep 1995)
99211.description:
From the Table of Contents:

Athyrn Calendar, James Clapperton - Broken Lands campaign addition
From the President, Jonathan Coulter - Hot air from the Prez
Ice Age Checklist - For Magic the Gathering
Battle Cyborgs, James Mumper - Warhammer 40K Imperial machines
New World Horizons, Michael Scott - Live role playing
High Priest Ketyad, Jonathan Coulter - Broken Lands personality
Squat Specials, James Mumper - Warhammer 40K special squat Characters
Event Watch - Information of area events
The Assassin Kit, Tim Morin - Fighter role play kit
Master of the Yakuza, James Mumper - A Shadowrun personality
Guild Treasure Trove, Lee Ruleman and Tim Morin - Generic fantasy magical devices
Guardians Checklist - Checklist for another cool card game
Special Forces, Shane Nicholson - New Imperial forces for Star Wars RPG
Machines of War, Jonathan Coulter - New war machines for Fantasy Warriors
Dark Elf Quick List - Warhammer Armies quick reference chart
Fire Magik, Jonathan Coulter - Generic fantasy elemental fire spells
Imperial Database, Robert Burke - A collection of new Star Wars aliens
The Guild II, James Clapperton - Criminal Organization for Champions
Search fot the Talisman, Donald Carter - Warhammer Fantasy scenario
Civil War Jargon, Jonathan Coulter - Military terms for ACW historical Gamers
Mission AG117, Daniel Herbstreith - Warhammer 40,000 scenario
Guild Benefits - SVGG membership benefits
Membership Application - Join the SVGG information

99212.name: Elements
99212.description:
User Summary

This is a virtual card game similar in play to Magic the Gathering. There are twelve different colors of cards, you choose one to start in and can then customize your deck by buying and selling cards. Money is won by defeating seven levels of AI or playing against another person. After defeating the harder AIs, you have a chance to win random cards from their deck.

Cards are available in normal and upgraded forms, upgrades are available when all the quests are finished for 1500 coins per upgrade.

Winning is done by forcing the other person to draw a card when they are unable to or reducing their life to zero.

Tournaments are held regularly, often with themes your deck must adhere to.

This game is available on several sites and is very popular.

99214.name: Hurry-Up Misfitz
99214.description:
A set collection game with some of the finest card illustrations. 72 cards making 24 pictures cut into three parts.
Each player is given 12 counters. Everyone now puts 5 counters into the 'Pool' and receives cards, leaving half the pack as a 'reserve'.
The player sitting left of the dealer starts and must play the first card of any set, if he has one. The next player plays a second card to the set started by the player to his right, if he has such a card. And so on, until a full set of three cards is revealed. The player playing the third part of the set (actually, called a trick in the rules), and must now start a new set if he can. There are penalties for a player not playing a card when he should or if the wrong picture is completed and so on. If you genuinely cannot play a card, you draw a card from the reserve.
Interestingly, for a game of this age, you can score bonus points for certain tricks or negative bonuses for some tricks.
For example, completing the Baby set takes 5 counters from the pool and one counter from every other player, or completing the Horse Omnibus set pays three counters into the pool, and so on.
The player taking the most tricks when all 24 sets have been completed takes the remaining counters in the pool and the player now with the most counters, wins the game.

99215.name: Moods & Faces
99215.description:
52 cards in sets of four, each depicting a face that is revealing a certain look; smiling, frowning, angry, etc.
I don't have the rules so I don't know more details. The cards are beautifully illustrated. Could be a Snap type game (although the cards would not suit a children's game). I would think it had more adult appeal.

99216.name: BattleTechnology (Issue 18 - Jan 3052)
99216.description:
Cover headline: In Trouble NOW !

Cover art: Steve Venters

Contents

News Flash
Intersecting Lines, part 1
Achilles, The Clan Stopper

DEPARTMENTS
BattleTechnology News Service
- News of the Inner Sphere
- Man in the Street Interviews
- The Sergeant Speaks his Mind
BattleTac
- What Now, MechWarrior?
BattleMechanics
- Technical Readout (x3)
- Maligned, But Much Modified: The UrbanMech
Coming Up For BattleTech

BATTLETECH SIMULATOR
Combat Efficiency Factors: The Clans
The Archer Fells the Hawk

BattleTechnology Presents:
The Secret of Kepler Station - A scenario for MechWarrior II
__________________________
>

99217.name: Cubex Playing Cards
99217.description:
Cubex consists of 9 cubes, with each side representing a playing card, so you get 54 sides (1 deck + 2 jokers).
The play is rather interesting. First you take the cubes out of the box, then, in turn order, each player selects a cube and places it back into the box. Once all 9 cubes are back in the box, the second phase begins. The starting player takes any cube from the four corners and starts to form a 3 x 3 wall of 'bricks'. The next selected cube must be taken from the space adjacent to the first cube, in clockwise order. Remember, when you choose a cube and place it, the opposite side of the cube will be facing your opponent, so you need to help yourself whilst also giving non-attractive 'cards' to your opponent.
The main game is one where you try to get the best Brag (a form of Poker but only three cards count) hand facing you. There are other games suggested, with a form of Patience being the best.

99218.name: Top Club Soccer

21332.name: David Nish and Roger Davies Productions

99218.description:
A Monopoly type game (roll the dice, move round the board, but this game is set in the world of football.
Contents - the box says 'This box contains one playing board and approximately 450 components'.
Each player has the objective to take his team from the 3rd Division to the 1st Division and then to win the title. There are numerous cards such as, Press Report, Disciplinary Hearing, Result, that sort of thing.
The idea is to buy players who are good in the Division you are currently in, and improve the team's performance. The track on board is octagonal and six sides relate to week-days and two sides relate to Saturday morning and afternoon. On that afternoon you collect gate receipts when you pass the square designated for that purpose. This improves as you rise up the divisions. Also in this section, you can choose to earn 1 point for your match (the game was a draw) or you can purchase a Result card and take your chances.
The designers were two British footballers, quite well-known.

99219.name: Swish
99219.description:
Swish is a pattern recognition card game reminiscent of Set that challenges a player to make matches – dubbed "Swishes" – before opponents.

Swish includes 60 transparent cards; each card has some combination of balls and hoops on it, with these items coming in four colors. To set up the game, lay out 16 cards on the table. Players simultaneously try to create "Swishes" by spotting two or more cards that can be laid on top of one another in some manner so that every ball fits in a hoop of the same color. Create a Swish, and you claim the cards used, with new cards then being laid out. Whoever claims the most cards wins the game.

The game includes varied levels of play so that the spatially clueless can compete against Tetris-heads.

99220.name: Tumble Track
99220.description:
Fun game for children. The box holds a number of plastic tracks that link together. They can be used in many different configurations.
Each child gets a plastic 'Mexican Jumping Bean'. They place their bean in the starting gate, and the gate is opened. First down the course is the winner. No skill, just amusement.

99221.name: Snuffy Race
99221.description: Children's action game. Each player has a small, walking, plastic dog. The dog must be propelled along a winding track, to eventually reach the bone-filled dog bowl in the centre of the board. Propulsion is achieved by puffing your dog up its rear end, with small plastic bellows.

99223.name: Blaze & Blade: Eternal Quest
99223.description:
From the back of the box:

Enter the magical Land of Foresia, where you can participate in the adventures of four heroes who travel the land in search of fame and treasure. Discover Foresia's incredible landscape with all its dangerous monsters and secret locations. Walk the perilous paths into the numerous dungeons and prepare for the unkown!

All of which means you're guaranteed the finest Action-FRP time of your life!


3D based user-friendly and easy-to-start Action RPG.



A total of 16 different player characters offers many different ways to play and complete the game.



400 items of armour, weaponry and other helpful accessories to be found.



The solid and versatile 3D engine ensures smooth gameplay as well as a variety of camera angles to choose from.

99224.name: F1 Manager
99224.description:
From the back of the box

F1 Manager

Can you make it in the tough world of Formula 1 motor racing? F1 Manager is the best way to find out! Negotiate with the banks and sponsors, refine your car for ultimate performance, select the best drivers and mechanics for your team, then put your decisions to the test at the world's most famous circuits.
It's the first product of its kind to offer multiple 3D SVGA real-time race views, with a driver's-eye perspective AND numerous overhead shots from TV vantage points.
With F1 Manager you can compete for a full season or set your own targets. Whatever you choose, the program offers plenty of on-screen help. F1 Manager is set to take over your life!


Various degrees of difficulty cater for beginners and experts.



Select your own staff or take over one of the top teams.



Build prototypes in the research and development centre.



Use the detailed business model to negotiate sponsorship and merchandising deals and keep a healthy balance sheet.



Practise at one of 16 circuits, communicate with your drivers during the race, and fight time with ultra-realistic manual or automatic pit stops.

99225.name: Doctor Who Monster Invasion
99225.description:
A magazine that comes with collectible trading cards themed mostly on the new Doctor Who adventures, with some special cards recalling the earlier TV series. Each issue of DWMI contains a new game using the cards, which have a range of stats unique to that card. The first issue contains the games, Stat Attack, Survivor and Alien Attack, and playmats for the games.
Stat Attack is a straight comparison of stats, like Top Trumps.
The second issue introduces the game UNIT Challenge, where you can combine stats on your cards to get a higher rating.

99226.name: Railway Pioneers
99226.description:
An educational game featuring the building of the railways across North America in the 19th century.
The board is overlayed with a square grid and each square has a number in it (from 2 to 10) and this is the cost of building a railway through that square. Railways are drawn on the board as they are built (similar to Railway Rivals).
Two packs of Chance Cards, but these are way too lucky or unlucky. One pack is used until someone reaches the Rocky Mountains and then the 2nd stack is used "More in keeping with the 2nd phase of the game" say the rules.
The Railway Pioneer with the most money after a set time, wins.

99227.name: Rallytaire
99227.description:
Rallytaire is a paper and pencil rally game for one player. You have to plan ahead and adapt to the track and sometimes push your luck a bit. It has mechanics similar to Formula D but using only six sided dice and corners are also handled differently.

Players choose which gear to drive in, roll a few 6 sided dice and move according to those rolls. Then they write their position on the track with the goal of getting as fast as possible through it. Players can push their cars to the limit trying to win some time and between stages it's possible to fix the car so it will be ready for the next track.

Drift through those corners and beat the tracks record!

99228.name: Yoga-Yingo
99228.description:
In Yoga-Yingo players preform different Yoga poses to fill up a BINGO style card.The cards contain a 3x3 grid of photos of yoga poses. Players assume and hold the pose to cover the space. First to cover three in a row wins.

Product Features

Pictures demonstrating each yoga pose and modifications
Instructions include Sanskrit names for kids who would like to learn more
Instructions include modifications to increase/decrease challenges
Contains 12 game board cards.
Non-competitive play. Gross motor play and development

includes 12 game cards, 8 pose cards, 120 markers,and a Yoga pose instruction sheet.

99229.description:
Super Hero Dinosaurs have come to Infinity City! This Expansion deck is to be added to the original Numbers League game. It adds 30 new cards to the base game. Included in this expansion is:

21 heroes building cards(or when placed together 7 new heroes)
6 devices cards and
6 new villains

Note: Expansion needs the base game, it does not stand on its own. For more information on how this game plays, please see base game.
99229.name: Numbers League: Dinosaurs Expansion

99230.description:
Super Pets have come to Infinity City! This Expansion deck is to be added to the original Numbers League game. It adds 30 new cards to the base game. Included in this expansion is:

21 heroes building cards (for a total 7 new matching heroes)
6 devices cards and
6 new villains

Note: Expansion needs the base game, it does not stand on its own. For more information on how this game plays, please see base game.
99230.name: Numbers League: Critters Expansion

99231.name: 7 Little Words
99231.description:
User Summary

A word puzzle game for the iOS. Each puzzle consists of 7 clues and 20 letter groups of 2-3 letters each. Connect the groups in order to guess the clues.

The free game consists of 25 puzzles. More puzzles can be purchased through the in-app purchasing system.

99232.name: The Shadowfell: Gloomwrought and Beyond
99232.description:
Publisher Blurb:

The Shadowfell is a dark reflection of the natural world, a haunting plane where fear and death rule. Yet, within the gloom are countless lures for adventurers seeking fortune, glory, and more. Just don’t get caught alone at night!

This boxed set is for Dungeon Masters interested in taking their heroes on excursions to the Shadowfell, as well as Dungeon Masters looking for a sinister setting in which to run thrilling urban adventures. A 128-page book presents the fully detailed city of Gloomwrought, complete with location descriptions, maps, quests, and game statistics for monsters and villains. It also includes provides information on other locations heroes are likely to visit beyond the city’s dark walls. In addition, the box contains a 32-page book of encounters set in Gloomwrought and beyond, two card stock sheets of die-cut monster and villain tokens, a foldout battle map, and a deck of 30 cards that DMs can use to add suspense to any Shadowfell-based adventure.

99233.description:
Description from the back of the book

WARMACHINE: PRIME(tm) takes you beyond the Battle Box and thrusts you into full blown conflict! Within, you'll find an extensive history of the Iron Kingdoms, background on all of the WARMACHINE factions, and complete army rosters with dozens of of characters, units, and warjacks, so you can build the army you desire. Assemble tactical forces to skirmish in tight quarters, or grow your force and wage war on an apocalyptic scale!

Additionally, you'll find scenarios, tactics, templates, and a fantastic full color showcase and painting guide by Privateer's very own Rivet Head Studios.

WARMACHINE: PRIME provides you with everything you need to keep the battle raging.
99233.name: Warmachine Prime

133051.name: Dice Age Alpha Edition: Blue Tide series

99235.description:
Unbalanced, designer's toy dice. They can be used in different specific games, of skill (totem game), of strategy (the War of the Lords), of risk-taking (The Crown of Lords), as divination device or as dominoes... Our players come up with new games and rules all the time.

Components: Dice (24 different dice in the Fundamental series), Dice Pouch.
Unique Game Aspect: Unbalanced and artistic handmade dice that can be played in different ways.
99235.name: Dice Age Alpha Edition: Fundamental series

99236.name: Crazy Bugs
99236.description:
"Crazy Bugs" is a card game that shows how bugs, worms, and other insects support a healthy environment. A cross between "Crazy Eights" and "Trivial Pursuit," "Crazy Bugs" teaches children how, in some countries, insects serve as a main food source; and how insects generate things like honey, wax, and dyes.

The object of the game is to get rid of all your "Deal Me In" Cards by answering questions about insect life and the environment and win!

Contents:

52 Deal Me In Cards,
2 Wild Bug Cards,
45 Bug Fact Cards,

99237.name: Destruction Derby Raw
99237.description:
From the back of the box

Raw action, Raw power, Raw speed

31 tracks
1-4 players
Pass da Bomb
Skyscraper Challenge
Smash for cash
Wreckin Racing

Real Destruction

99238.name: LMA Manager
99238.description:
From the back of the box

Take your team to the top, be it league, Cup or Europe. Run the club your way, make your own history. Endorsed by the League Managers Association, the official body of English football managers. This is the most accurate and realistic management simulation ever.


The only football management game designed specifically for the playstation



Choose to play a full open ended game or 1 of 10 fixed challenges



Watch the match unfold in 3D making tactical changes and substitutions at any time.



Immersive after-match TV show - see results, highlights and commentary.



Control club finances, coaching, stadium development and player management or hire employees top do it for you.



Realistic kits, teams, strips and stadia for 302 clubs in 32 countries with 8000 players.

99239.name: Constellation Connect
99239.description:
Did you know the constellations are grouped by astronomers into families - like the Hercules, Heavenly Waters and Ursa Major families - whose members are in the same region of the night sky?

Constellation Connect! is a stellar variation of Go Fish Children explore the stars and collect star points while learning major regions of the night sky. Special cards like Comet Sighting, Northern Lights and Meteor Shower and also a galactic die to change the game play up in lots of spacey ways.throw fun and crazy twists into the game play. An included subject guide teaches about the many multicultural mythologies tied to the constellations.

99240.name: Rock of Ages
99240.description:
The game combines tower defense strategy with a rolling ball mechanic similar to games such as Marble Madness and Super Monkey Ball. The aim of the game is to use a large stone boulder to attack the enemy's castle at the bottom of the hill, whilst using various defensive structures to defend your own. Players can use a variety of obstacles to defend the path leading up to the castle, such as buildings, dynamite, windmills and animals.

Source: Wikipedia, "Rock of Ages (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

99241.name: Victory Boxing Champion Edition
99241.description:
User Summary

Create your boxer and move up through the ranks to become the world champion. With different fighting styles depending on your size, power, preferred stance and personality. "Peek-a-boo", "Detroit" and "Open" each with "KO punches" which boxers learn as they move up through the ranks.

99242.name: Sesame Street 1 2 3
99242.description:
Sesame Street 1-2-3 featured two different games: Astro-Grover, and Ernie's Magic Shapes. In Ernie's Magic Shapes, you had to match the right symbol to a base symbol. Astro-Grover was a simple math game.

Source: Wikipedia, "Sesame Street video games", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

99243.name: Shining Force CD
99243.description:
User Summary

Shining Force CD is a turn-based tactical RPG and is part of the Shining Force series. The player will control his characters within each battle and direct them to engage the enemy on a battlefield grid. The game is comprised of four books. It begins by compiling the two earlier Game Gear games; Shining Force Gaiden and Shining Force Gaiden II into the first two books. Once the player completes these two books, they are allowed to play Books 3 & 4. These are totally new scenarios involving some of the same characters as Books 1 & 2. There are a total of 53 tactical battles within this game.

99244.name: Need for Speed: V-Rally 2
99244.description:
From the back of the box

Get behind the wheel of 16 World Rally Championship cars and have your driving skills well and truly tested over 70 special stages set in 12 different countries under various gruelling conditions. V-Rally 2 provides unprecedented realism: progressive build up of dirt and car damage, animated pilot and co-pilot, in-race animations on the roadsides...

So, if you reckon you're up to the challenge, go for it and try and lift the Championship title.


Exclusive track editor/generator
4 player simultaneous play on one playstation (using a Multi Tap)
4 game modes available
"If you're not careful, this could rule your life"

99245.name: BattleTechnology (Issue 19 - May-Jun 3052)
99245.description:
Cover headline: TRUCE !

Cover art: Steve Venters

Contents

Truce Won From Clans: Tukayyid
A Plea to the Inner Sphere
Nicolai Khorsakov Interview
Why The Chancellor Doesn't Like Us
Intersecting Lines, part 2
Taking the War Back to the Clans
The Run of the Redcoat Renegades

DEPARTMENTS
BattleTechnology News
Field Modification Kits
BattleTech Simulator
- Redcoat Renegades Scenarios
BattleTac
- What Now, MechWarrior?
What's New for BattleTech

SPECIAL BATTLETECH SIMULATOR
Field Task Forces: One Unit's Combined Arms Planing
'Mech and Vehicle Designs
__________________________
>

99247.name: Little League Baseball: Championship Series
99247.description:
From the back of the box:

Little League Baseball! It's the game every kid in America loves to play... And now you can experience the fun and excitement of Little League Baseball at any time of the year, rain or shine, day or night - right in your own living room!

Create your own winning team of players with batting, fielding, pitching, and running characteristics you can tailor to your own specifications. Then challenge a friend or the computer to a worldwide Championship Series tournament.

You are in full control of your players: Jump or dive for a tricky catch... Choose a full swing or a bunt for your batter... Shift fielders at will... Send in a pinch hitter or runner... Select a fast ball, slow ball, or curve ball for your pitcher... Steal a base if you dare... Or you might even try a squeeze play!

Little League Baseball has been an American institution for 50 years - and you can be a part of it. If you're a Little League fan or a Little League player - or if you ever wanted to be - here's your chance to go for the glory!

99248.name: FoxKids.com Micro Maniacs Racing
99248.description:
From the back of the box

A Different Race Altogether


Minature multi-player mayhem, with up to 8 players racing on 41 all-action tracks.



8 characters bursting with attitude and a further 4 racers to unlock through the game.



Amazing environments from Science lab, Toy store, Japanese garden to Student kitchen.



Special weapons, including yoyo, plasma punch and fireball fart.



Race alone or with friends in a variety of modes, including Challenge, Time Trial and Tournament.

99249.name: Orb-3D
99249.description:
You are an Explorer First Class, on assignment in a remote corner of the universe. Space stations, Colonial Cruisers and whole solar systems have mysteriously disappeared in this region. A nearby planet is buzzing with rumors of an evil space wizard, Krohn. He controls an enormous Black hole which has already begun to double in size. Your ship, the Millennium Orb, is the only space craft capable of withstanding the energy forces of Krohn's Black Hole. There are 30 Enigma Chambers separating you from Krohn. Each chamber will test your wits, skill, cunning and courage. You must keep the Millennium Orb in position by manipulating force shields at the top and bottom of each chamber in Krohn's domain. You must keep within the plane and deal with the dangers hurled at you by the malicious wizard. The fate of the entire Universe is in your hands.

The game is noteworthy for employing the Pulfrich effect, an optical trick created with the use of "3-D" glasses (of which one lens is clear and the other tinted) that come with the game. The effect is produced by the constantly-moving player ship.

Source: Wikipedia, "Orb-3D", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

99250.name: Encounters in the Phoenix Quadrant
99250.description:
From the Introduction:

Encounters in the Phoenix Quadrant is the first in a series of mini-adventures. The encounters can be used as is or added to a campaign as a source for non-player characters.

User summary:

Consists of descriptions and deckplans for three different starships along with dossiers for the NPC crew members. There are no adventure scenarios, per se.

99251.name: Encounters in the Ventura Quadrant
99251.description:
From the Introduction:

Encounters in the Ventura Quadrant is the third in a series of starship books approved for use with Traveller™. It consists of four different ships, from mercenary to a shuttle. Each ship is complete with descriptions of crew, compartments, and floor plan. The encounters can be used as is or added to a campaign as a source for non-player characters.

99252.name: Cross Purposes
99252.description:
Players take turns building a crossword puzzle in the provided grid using a hand of random clues and a hand of letter tiles. Clues come in five types:
Same or Opposite: the solution is a synonym or antonym of the clue word.
Crossword Clue: the solution word and the clue word are broadly related, perhaps in a punning way.
A Word Including: the solution word contains the clue word.
Clue It Yourself: the solution word may be any word, provided the player provides a suitable clue.
Found With: the solution word and the clue word are found together in some phrase.
Words are scored at a simple one point per letter.

99253.name: R.B.I. Baseball 3
99253.description:
Sequel to R.B.I. Baseball 1 and 2 -

R.B.I. Baseball 3: RBI 3 also has every major league team available from the 1990 season, as well as postseason teams from 1983-1989. A regular season feature was available for RBI 3. Players could choose one team to compete against every other team. All star teams and postseason teams were eligible for this season mode. Passwords were given after each game to help players complete schedules. Once all teams had been defeated, the player had to compete against a fictional all star team from Japan, which included players with incredible HR and AVE stats and pitchers that could not be hit.

Source: Wikipedia, "R.B.I. Baseball", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

99254.name: Monopoly: The Lord of the Rings Collectors Edition
99254.description: This game is different and uniqe from the Lord of the Rings Monopoly, Trilogy edition. This one has different pieces, the board art is unique. The box size is the same as most other collectable versions of Monopoly. This version comes with the following pewter tokens: The sword Sting, Aragorn's Crown, an Elven Broach, Boromir's Gondorian Horn, Gandalf's Hat, and Bill the Pony.

99255.name: SegaScope 3-D Glasses
99255.description:
The LCD shutter glasses rapidly alternate between the left and right lenses being opaque, used in tandem with two different alternating images flashed from the TV synchronized with the switching of the 3-D Glasses to create a natural stereoscopic 3D effect. The Master System glasses can only be used in the original Master System, since it hooks up directly to the card port not found in the Master System II. This system allows 3-D graphics in full color. The technology takes advantage of the interlaced video output of contemporary CRT televisions, displaying the left image in the top field and the right image in the bottom field. Only eight Master System games are 3-D compatible.

Source: Wikipedia, "Sega Master System", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

99256.name: DanceDanceRevolution
99256.description:
Description:
With over 11 years of history, DanceDanceRevolution® comes to the PS3 for the first time integrating PlayStation Move!

DanceDanceRevolution's official song list includes:

Licensed Master Tracks

Song Title - Artist
According to You - Orianthi
Animal - Ke$ha
Bad Romance - Lady Gaga
Battlefield - Jordin Sparks
Celebration - Kool and the Gang
crushcrushcrush - Paramore
Dancing in the Street - Martha and the Vandellas
Hey, Soul Sister - Train
I Got You - Leona Lewis
I'm Yours - Jason Mraz
Love Like This - Natasha Bedingfield
Love Shack - The B-52's
Missing - Everything But The Girl
My Life Would Suck Without You - Kelly Clarkson
Need You Now - Lady Antebellum
Plastic Beach - Gorillaz (feat. Mick Jones & Paul Simonon)
Rio - Duran Duran
So Fine - Sean Paul
Venus - Bananarama
We Are Family - Sister Sledge

Original Music by KONAMI Japan

Song Title - Artist
Rescue Me - NAOKI feat. Fracus
dreaming can make a wish come true - jun & NRG Factory feat. Anna Kaelin
Private Eye - atomsoak ft. cerol
IN THE ZONE - U1 (NPD3 style) & KIDD KAZMEO
Top The Charts - J-Mi & Midi-D feat. Hanna Stockzell
Let's Get Away - NAOKI featt. Brenda Burch

Features
-Record yourself and upload to YouTube and Facebook through to share with friends and other DanceDanceRevolution fans
-Dance Off Mode allows players to take turns to play, while they see themselves dancing on screen through the PlayStation® EYE . The player who is able to step and dance more accurately will gain more points and will be the winner
-Club Mode allows players to play 4 to 20 songs consecutively. The difficulty level varies depending on how well the player is dancing in addition to several different gimmicks. If the player changes the options to non-stop, they can keep dancing until their gauge is empty
-Includes hard hitting music tracks, including "Bad Romance" by Lady Gaga, "Battlefield" by Jordin Sparks and "So Fine" by Sean Paul

Source: The Publisher Website.

99257.description:
Mondo: Das Duell takes the components from Michael Schacht's Mondo and presents two players with new challenges in a head-to-head duel.

To play, a duel card is revealed that shows the current challenge – most forest, largest desert, largest landscape, etc. – and the player who meets this challenge best while following the standard placement rules for tiles wins the duel card. (Animals and volcanoes are not relevant in this game.) The first player to win two cards wins the game.

Mondo: Das Duell, which consists of ten duel cards and five rule cards, is a giveaway item in German game stores for customers who purchase Mondo.

Home Page & Newsletter:

www.mondo-game.com




(German and english)
99257.name: Mondo: Das Duell

99258.description:
Skirmish Wars: Blitz is the first expansion for the lightweight, tactical wargame based on the wildly popular turn-based strategy game series Advance Wars, originally released on the Game Boy Advance by Nintendo. Skirmish Wars is a print-and-play game that uses a modular, customizable map system for endless replayability, and simple mechanics to streamline gameplay.

While the objectives of a given game of Skirmish Wars will vary from scenario to scenario, The classic objective is to win by capturing your enemy's HQ or failing that, by eliminating all of his units. To do so, a player must manage and secure new sources of limited funds, think quickly to out-maneuver, out-produce, or out-gun his opponent, and be ready to counter enemy strategies and units with their own.

Skirmish Wars: Blitz introduces several new units including aircraft (all based on their counterparts from the original Video Game series) and eight new COs. It also introduces new rules for repairing units, rules for units with limited fuel (like air units), and finally a fifth side that may be played.
99258.name: Skirmish Wars: Blitz

99259.name: Shining Force Gaiden
99259.description:
User Summary

This game was the first of the turn-based tactical RPGs in the Shining Force series that released on the Sega Game Gear. Shining Force Gaiden never released in North America as a stand-alone game. It was only available in the United States as part of the Shining Force CD release for the Sega CD.

Players control their team of characters as they engage enemies on a grid-based battlefield. The characters have the ability to attack, cast a spell, use and item, or search the area. The units also gain experience by completing actions and defeating enemies.

The story of this game takes place between Shining Force I & II (both Sega Genesis releases.) It begins 20 years after the end of Shining Force. Woldol, the ambassador from the kingdom of Cypress kidnaps Anri, the princess of Guardiana. The player controls Nick, the hero of this game, as he gathers together warriors from the first Shining Force game as allies.

99260.name: Shining Force: The Sword of Hajya
99260.description:
User Summary
This game was the second of the turn-based tactical RPGs in the Shining Force series that released on the Sega Game Gear. The Japanese release is known as Shining Force Gaiden II: The Evil God Awakens, whereas the North American release was known as Shining Force: The Sword of Hajya. It was re-released as part of the Shining Force CD release for the Sega CD.

This game was the first of the turn-based tactical RPGs in the Shining Force series. Players control their team of characters as they engage enemies on a grid-based battlefield. The characters have the ability to attack, cast a spell, use and item, or search the area. The units also gain experience by completing actions and defeating enemies.

This is the first sequel to Shining Force Gaiden. The story takes place after the kingdoms of Cypress and Gardiana have brokered a truce in order to work together as they try to push back the invaders from the evil kingdom of Iom. Nick is now the prince of Cypress and is the leader of the coalition. His arm was turned to stone before the events in this game, and this handicap prevents him from wielding the legendary Sword of Hyjya. He leaves the sword in the castle under the protection of Deanna while he goes abroad seeking allies to join the opposition of Iom.

99261.name: The Tick
99261.description:
The Tick was a side-scrolling beat 'em up video game developed by Software Creations and released by Fox Interactive in 1994. The game was released on the Super NES and Sega Genesis systems and was based on the comic book and Fox Kids animated series of the same name.

The game's style was very typical for this side-scrolling genre. The Tick's signature humor is also present in various parts of the game, such as his unorthodox gestures and "Spoon!" battle cry after completing a level (and starting a level in the Genesis version). 44 levels make up the game with "wobble" environments and arcade style graphics.

However, in contrast to the popular animated series it was based on, the game was panned by critics. While the accurate graphics and jazzy background music were moderately well-received, the game was criticized for having seemingly generic hordes of ridiculous look-a-like enemies to combat and the limited punch-and-kick style. The game ending is also widely regarded as being empty and unrewarding. Brett Allan Weiss of Allgame had rated and evaluated The Tick as being "repetitive" and "boring."

Source: Wikipedia, "The Tick (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

99262.name: X-Zone
99262.description:
X-Zone is a game released in 1992 by Kemco for the Super NES. It was one of the few games to support the Super Scope light gun. The players assume the role of a soldier in flying power-armor assigned to destroy an army of malfunctioning defense robots commanded by a sentient bio-computer in its sudden war against humanity.

Source: Wikipedia, "X-Zone", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

99263.name: Super Godzilla
99263.description:
Super Godzilla (Chou-Gojira in Japan) is a video game for the Super Nintendo released in 1993 by Toho.

Unlike other games of the era, Super Godzilla is not a straight action game. Instead, the player must guide Godzilla into the different levels by pressing the adequate button in the appropriate place. The game is split in two screens: the top one shows the actions Godzilla is making at the moment, while the bottom one shows his location on the current level. When Godzilla finds a monster to battle, the game switches into a standard side-view fighting segment.

This game is known for having Bagan, a monster that was originally supposed to fight Godzilla in a feature film. The game is also known for substituting the Heisei Mechagodzilla for the original Mechagodzilla in the North American version of the game because Godzilla vs. Mechagodzilla II had not been released in North America at the time.

Story

Invading aliens have now approached Earth, threatening all life. The fate of the world lies in the hands in a small group of people, who enlist the aid of the King of Monsters Godzilla. Controlling the him through a transmitter on the Super X II, players must lead Godzilla through several cities to fight a final boss that awaits at the end of each level.

Specifics

* Use a wide variety of items to help beat monsters.
* Godzilla can smash through mountains, buildings and towers, but for reasons still unknown to this very day, you lose one health point.
* Beat the Mothership and you will eliminate all the UFO's for that round of the game.
* Each level is timed, and if you do not finish it in that time you will fail the level.
* You can only hold four colored orbs at a time, which can only be used in battle mode.
* The terrain that you walk on will affect the speed of which Godzilla moves (deep water takes a great deal of time to wade through).

Playable characters

* Godzilla - Defender of Japan, the atomic dinosaur that once destroyed civilization became humanity's only hope for survival. In his quest to rid the Earth of its aggressors, Godzilla was aided by a small band of humans that controlled the King of the Monsters as he faces other monsters.

* Super Godzilla - After King Ghidorah was resurrected as Mecha-King Ghidorah, the human characters determined that Godzilla must increase in power, and so Godzilla had to seek out the three capsules of Super S energy, only then would the monster transform into the godly stature of Super Godzilla. After defeating Mecha-King Ghidorah, Bagan, the ultimate enemy monster of the game appeared and Godzilla again changed into Super Godzilla in order to combat him.

Source: Wikipedia, "Super Godzilla", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

99264.name: Frisbee® Forever
99264.description:
Go wild in the worlds of Frisbee® Forever! An Universal App for iPod Touch, iPhone and iPad with super crisp HD and Retina 3D graphics.

Get ready for blast-off. Fly at breathtaking speed across more than 100 crazy tracks. Twist and turn in the California Theme Park, climb the majestic mountains in the Wild West or send the waves blazing in the Pirate filled Caribbean oceans. There’s a level for everyone!

Play with cool classic Wham-O® Frisbees® or brand new discs only available in Frisbee® Forever. Collect more than 100 Frisbees®, with plenty of trophies and secret bonuses to achieve.

Are you a Frisbee® Master? Get Frisbee® Forever in the app store now.

Source: The Game Website.

99265.name: Spirits

videogamehonor.30676: 2010 IndieCade Best Visual Design of the Year Winner

99265.description:
Spirits is an action-puzzle game for the iPad, iPhone and iPod touch where you manipulate wind and ground in the game world to guide the Spirits towards the goal. You have four different actions for this: Blow or block wind, dig tunnels and grow bridges of leaves. Sound and music are done completely with orchestral musical instruments. In combination with the hand-drawn graphics this gives the game a unique poetic feel.

Source: The Game Website.

99266.name: MetalStorm: Online
99266.description:
Experience the best looking, most action packed multiplayer jet fighting game for iOS - MetalStorm: Online. Play against other pilots online via Game Center, or invite your friends to join you in Co-Op mode. Talk to other pilots via the in-game voice chat system and coordinate your attacks. Unlock dozens of planes, weapons and equipment as you progress though one of the most beautiful 3D games for iOS.

FEATURES

Real-Time Multiplayer - Compete against other players online over 3G and WiFi
Next-Gen 3D graphics with Retina Display support
Dozens of unique aircraft to choose from
Customize your aircraft with missles and machine guns
Survival Mode: Obliterate waves of enemies with a friend in Co-Op Multiplayer
Perform advance maneuvers by swiping in different directions
Earn XP and level up to unlock more powerful items




Source: The Game Website.

99267.name: Archetype
99267.description:
User Summary

Multiplayer FPS for the iOS in a science-fiction setting. Features include:

• Multiplayer-only deathmatches for up to 5-on-5 combat
• Team battles across 13 maps and 20 levels with 7 weapons
• Rank up by earning EXP for winning games
• Game modes include: CTF, single-weapon blast zones, deathmatch, "free for all," and more.

Note: The "Cadet" editions are free but include only two levels.

99268.name: Battle Clash
99268.description:
Battle Clash, known in Japan as Space Bazooka, is a mecha-themed light gun shooting game produced by Nintendo and Intelligent Systems and released for the Super Nintendo Entertainment System in 1992. It was followed by Metal Combat: Falcon's Revenge during the following year.

In a distant future, Earth lives in chaos and the only order that rules resides in the Battle Game, where the winner takes control over the world. All battles are fought with mechs called Standing Tanks (ST). A merciless fighter called Anubis eventually becomes the champion of the Battle Game.

Mike Anderson, whose father was one of the many victims of Anubis, refuses to succumb, and trains himself in everything ST-related to stop the current chaos and avenge his father's death. To accomplish this, he must first defeat the Battle Chiefs (Anubis' subordinates).

In the game, the player is the gunner of the ST Falcon and also Mike's partner, who fights against a group of other STs in one-on-one battles. To attack, the player must shoot using the Super Scope. It is possible to shoot rapid shots by holding down the fire button, as well as energy bolts (charged shots). Energy bolts can be shot when an energy bar fills up (this happens when the player doesn't fire). When the energy bar has filled up, the energy bolt can be fired, though it will consume the energy bar. It is also important to defend against enemy attacks by shooting their fire. Some attacks can only be deflected by firing energy bolts.

The objective of the game is to defeat the rival ST to clear the stage. The damage inflicted on the enemy depends on the spot where the ST has been shot (all STs have some kind of weak point) and how powerful is the shot. The player wins if the rival ST's energy is depleted first. If the enemy depletes the player's energy or if the stage is played for ten minutes, then the game is over, but it is possible to continue the game indefinitely.

Source: Wikipedia, "Battle Clash", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

99269.name: Zenonia 3: The Midgard Story
99269.description:
The ZENONIA series gets revamped and up-scaled for an epic third generation, providing even greater enjoyment than the previous two ZENONIA's combined!

NEW FEATURES

VAST AND FASCINATING REALM OF MIDGARD
227 unique maps of Migard and 136 quests of action-packed adventure.

FOUR DISTINCTIVE CLASSES
Melee and range type classes to choose from; Sword Knight, Shadow Hunter, Mechanic Launcher and Nature Shaman.

ADDITIONAL NETWORK MODE
Combat through the new Execution Room Mode dungeons in single or asynchronous co-op play.

COLLECT ACHIEVEMENTS & TITLES
Acquire and show off 48 Game Center achievements plus 47 in-game titles with special effects.

OUT WITH THE OLD, IN WITH THE NEW
No more weight or hunger system. New slot-based inventory management and easier item combining.

─────────────────────

IMPROVED FEATURES

DYNAMIC CHARACTER CUSTOMIZATION
184 weapons, 120 helmets, 120 armors, 100 gauntlets and 100 footwear for maximum character customization.

THREE DIFFERENT MODES WITH PVP ARENA
Normal, Hard and Hell Mode plus an asynchronous online PvP arena to challenge friends.

GREATER RPG EXPERIENCE
Over 200 intelligent monsters, intuitive Fairy synchronization and more mini-puzzles to master.

INTRIGUING EPIC STORYLINE
An immersive new tale from the world of ZENONIA. What has happened to Regret? Who is Chael? What lies in Midgard?...

Source: The Game Website.

99270.name: Polyhedron (Issue 133 - Vol. 18, No. 6)
99270.description:
Cover art: Pete Venters, Goblin King, gave us this rendition of goblinly goodness a banquet. Mmm - Beefy! (from page 4)

The theme for this issue was cooking, including the credits page, which listed 'Floor Manager,' 'Grand Chef,' 'Maitre D,' 'Wait Staff,' and 'Dishwasher' instead of the normal titles (publisher, editor, etc.).

99271.name: Barbie Super Model
99271.description:
Barbie Super Model is a one or two player video game that allows the player to play as Barbie. The main part of the game comprises very simple arcade-style sequences. In each level, the player must navigate from one end of a horizontally scrolling area to the other, avoiding all of the obstacles and potential hazards coming towards the main character. This game was available for the Sega Genesis and the Super NES.

The levels each have a different theme. The themes include driving Barbie's convertible in Hollywood, roller skating in Hawaii, walking in the snow during a vacation in Vail, and riding her bike in New York City. The arcade-style sequences are interspersed with sections that test the player's memory. At the half-way point of each level the player can practice Barbie's moves for a fashion show. At the end of each level, the player must correctly perform these moves from memory.

By collecting certain objects, the player can unlock bonus rounds. The aim of these rounds is to dress Barbie and choose her makeup and earrings in order to match magazine covers. The two player option is essentially the same as the one player option; the players take turns in completing the same levels, and do not interact with one another.

Source: Wikipedia, "Barbie Super Model", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

99272.name: The Achilus Assault
99272.description:
Publisher Blurb:

The Achilus Assault is an invaluable sourcebook for Deathwatch, and is a guide to the fires of war raging in the Jericho Reach, from the numberless tides of the Tyranids in Hive Fleet Dagon to the hellish legions of Chaos pouring forth from the Hadex Anomaly and the expansionist aggression of the Tau Empire. The threats presented in this tome provide Game Masters with a surfeit of antagonists and mysteries to confront a Deathwatch Kill-team.

The essence of war, brotherhood, heroism, and duty pervade the setting for Deathwatch. The task of the Achilus Crusade embraces all of these themes, yet it faces great challenges from both without and within. To live up to these ideals is a difficult task, yet it is the fate of the Deathwatch Space Marines in the Jericho Reach to shoulder this duty head-on—they are the first and last line of defence against a myriad of threats to the Crusade of which some commanders are not even aware.

99273.name: Black Crusade: Game Master's Kit
99273.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Guide your players down the path of Chaos with The Game Master’s Kit for Black Crusade! This helpful resource features a sturdy Game Master’s screen, displaying stunning Black Crusade art on one side and a wealth of useful quick references on the other. In addition, The Game Master’s Kit includes a 32-page full colour booklet with a complete adventure, a selection of useful NPCs, expanded rules for running Black Crusade adventures, and advice for how to run an extended campaign.

The included adventure takes a group of Heretics to the shattered ruins of an infamous pirate empire. Once there, they’ll find a harsh reminder that the Screaming Vortex teems with other servants of Chaos, and in each one burns the same bloody determination to earn glory by any means necessary. While on a hunt for a cultural relic of great influence that was lost in the wreck of a mercenary transport ship, the Heretics will begin a race for power against ruthless competition. But rival fortune-seekers may not be the greatest threat they face; their prize is on the brutal world of Sacgrave, a warp-ravaged planet that’s home to marauding gangs, horrific mutants, and worse. Gather clues, coerce the local populace, and deal with the planet’s fickle overseer, and you’ll earn the favour of your dark masters.

Glory and power await those willing to learn forbidden knowledge.

99274.name: The Harvest
99274.description:
Each player is running their own vineyard. You are attempting to grow grapes and sell them to increase your wealth and also undertake research to improve your knowledge so that you are able to grow each grape harvest more efficiently.

The game is card based and during each turn you typically play a card from your hand and then draw another card from the draw pile.

The game goes over a number of rounds. Each round is ended when one of the players undertakes a grape harvest. The person who harvests is able to gain wealth while their opponent has the potential to improve their knowledge.

The winner is the first person to either 12 points of wealth (with at least 4 points of knowledge) or 6 points of knowledge (with at least 5 points of wealth).

99275.name: Strike to Stun (Issue 4 - Sep 2002)
99275.description:
Previous Issue

From the website:

"Strike to Stun provides material for both WFRP 1st and 2nd edition like adventures, articles, house-rules as well as reviews of WFRP-related stuff."

There is no Contents page nor is there an editorial. The PDF archive consists of a zipped folder with separate PDF files of each article.

99276.name: Das kleine Grillquiz
99276.description: A small trivia game about barbecuing; with 100 questions and answers. The game itself is like a notebook (with spiral binding). Each page contains 2 questions and 4 possible answers, the back side contains the correct answers with additional information.

99277.name: A Trip To Mars
99277.description:
A simple roll-and-move game but with an added feature, you may be instructed to move in or out of the orbit you are currently in. The first to reach Mars (after starting at Earth) wins. Should you be unlucky enough to fall into the Sun, you are out of the game.

The game is featured in Victorian Board Games by Olivia Bristol.

Another version produced by Glevum has similar game plan but updated graphics from around the 1920s

99278.name: Pocket Geni Universitetet i Oslo
99278.description:
A custom-made version of the Geni Pocket game (http://www.boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/69152/pocket-geni-cla...) made to the 200th years anniversary of University of Oslo (UiO) in 2011.

The game contains 450 Q&As about UiO, in six categories; UiO, studies and student life, science and medicin, history and society, culture and language, mixed.

99279.name: BattleTechnology (Issue 20 - Jul 3053)
99279.description:
Cover headline: Up To Our Necks!

Glossy Cover art: Nelson Snook

Contents

BattleTechnology News: Comstar Splits Up
Hanse Davion Remembered
Intersecting Lines, Part 3
The Sage of the Amaris Star
A Soldier's Luck

DEPARTMENTS
MechTac
- A Mucky Time
- One Man, One Death
House Rules Department
- Random Inclinations for NPCs
BattleTac
- What Now, MechWarrior?
BattleTech Simulator
- A Soldier's Luck Scenarios
What's New for BattleTech

BATTLETECH SIMULATOR
Clytemnestra BattleMech
Frankenstein's Monster BattleMech
__________________________
>

99280.name: BattleTechnology (Issue 21 - Dec 3054)
99280.description:
Cover headline: The Dragon Dies

Cover art: Steve Venters

Contents

BattleTechnology News: Trouble in Wolf's Dragoons
Smoke Jaguar Reply to Our Challenge
Psychology & The Clans
New Mercs on the Block
BattleTechnology News: The Lighter Side
Target of Opportunity
Takashi Kurita Dies
A Leg to Stand On
Snake Dance
Repel Boarders if You Can

DEPARTMENTS
MechTac
- Special Forces and Their BattleMechs
Thornhill Arms
BattleTac
- What Now, MechWarrior?
BattleTech Simulator
- Snake, Rattle & Roll
What's New for BattleTech

BATTLETECH SIMULATOR
Avatar BattleMech
Rattlesnake BattleMech
__________________________

99281.name: Circuit Breakers (1998)
99281.description:
From the back of the box

Prepare yourself for the fastest, most stomach churning racing game ever!

Circuit Breakers is like no other racing game on earth! Up to four players can battle head to head on over 30 roller coaster race tracks in a choice of 8 spectacular 3D worlds. No dull 'corridor' racing, each track features hair-raising banked corners, heart-in-the-mouth jaw-dropping dips and buttock-clenching drops - all in spectacular 3D.

99283.name: All About Ithaca & Tompkins County, NY
99283.description:
"An exciting, fast moving game of travel" - from box.

The object of the game is for players to travel on the gameboard to the locations shown on their shopping lists. The first player to return to their residence with the travel cards for all locations contained on their shopping list wins the game!

Players start with $2000 and get 10x the dice roll in money when they visit the bank initially (which has to be done first). To get the travel cards, players need to pay 10x the dice roll on the turn that they visit that location. Players can visit the bank later in the game, but not until they run out of money. Players get 10x their die roll and need to pay back what they owe with 10% interest. Players can choose to stay at the bank and roll for one additional turn and collect 10x what their roll is.

99284.name: Porsche Challenge
99284.description:
From the back of the box

From the team behind the award-winning Total NBA '96 comes the next generation in sports-car racing with Porsche's latest motoring triumph, The Boxster.

24 formidable tracks, perfect Porsche technology combined with perfect real-time light sourcing and shading, putting you right in the driving seat, closer than ever to the ultimate driving experience!

99285.name: BattleTechnology: The Lost Issues (Special Edition 1992)
99285.description:
Front cover art: Thena MacArthur
Back cover art: Stavros Ploumitsakos and James Hauser

Contents

What Really Happened?
Piercing the Veil of History
Cold Misery
The Last Confederate
MechWarriors Tell Their Tales

Special Bonus Section!
BattleTechnology 0101 - The Original issue!

MechTac
- NAIS Midterm Exam
- BattleTech Simulator
BattleMech Design
- Targeting / Tracking Systems
- The Best Came first
Battlefield Salvages
BattleMech Art
__________________________

144029.name: Raiding Parties: Brethren Of The Coast

99286.description: Raiding Parties is a pirate themed deck-building game in which you are the commander who selects a crew to hire as part of your Raiding Party, and then players will test their fate on the battlefield! All of the artwork has been created by Don Maitz (the creator of the Captain Morgan Spiced Rum Logo) including the card template and the game logo. This is a fast paced game of pirate battles where each card has weapons and abilities that "hit" on certain flips from a separate deck of 52 playing cards.
99286.name: Raiding Parties

99287.name: Flying Hamster
99287.description:
Newton the hamster is having fun on the beach with his friend Sookie when they discover a mysterious golden seed. As Sookie was holding this very shiny seed in her hands, suddenly a crazy eagle comes from nowhere and kidnaps her carrying her high into the sky.

Newton quickly gathers all of his courage and begins work on an improvised whirlybird made from a natural green-shoot and a tight belt. Then adding the final touches of an old-timer leather helmet and some flight goggles (just because it's stylish) he's now ready for action.

Fly, Newton, fly! Go after your girl and get back your golden seed!

Newton spits the ammo he finds within the levels. He can stock various stuff in his jowls and spit it at his enemies. He is also capable of charging and releasing a special attack. Each type of ammo has a different special attack.

Source: The Game Website.

99288.name: Supermarket Mania
99288.description:
Running a grocery store can be a lot of fun! Help Nikki keep five stores stocked to the rafters with the provisions customers want. Nikki must stay on her stylish toes as she reloads shelves and cleans up spills because her big business rival is out to shut her down and will show no mercy. If you work fast and hard, and please the demanding customers that enter through your doors, you'll earn enough money to upgrade your establishments and show your adversary what a little hometown pluck can do!

Run five distinct stores through 50 manic yet fun-filled stock-‘til-you-drop levels, stock over a dozen of products to sell, serve seven types of hard-to-please customers, and earn enough money to purchase over 20 accessories and upgrades that will help you turn your enterprise into success.


Support of iPhone 4 Retina Display
50 Levels in Story Mode
Endless Shift Mode with Global Leader Board and extra bonuses
Five Shops
Seven types of customers
Over a dozen products to sell
Over 20 accessories and upgrades for your shop
Hours of fun!


Source: The Game Website.

99289.name: Candy Train
99289.description:
Sweet, glorious candy is popping up everywhere. Don’t ask us how it happens! The best part? You’re a conductor on a train that collects it. But whoever built the train track didn’t get hugs when he was little, or failed basic engineering. So it’s up to you to drive the train while piecing the track together and collecting the candy. If you can’t clear a path for your train in time, you’ll suffer a sad, sugar-coated demise. Time is running out. What do you do? What. Do. You. Do?

Source: The Developer Website.

99290.name: Unpleasant Horse
99290.description:
The good news is that you are a horse with wings. Nobody doesn’t like those! The bad news is that you are a, well, rather unpleasant horse with wings. How unpleasant? Glad you asked. Get this: Your idea of a good time is bouncing from cloud to cloud and on to the backs of other, cuter flying ponies, who will thus be sent plummeting to a gruesome, bone-chewing demise, thanks to an unfortunately placed series of meat grinders on the ground below. (Really kind of a tragedy of civil engineering.) All is well and good for you, though—unless you happen to miss a cloud or pony, and then, guess what? Those meat grinders don’t play favorites. So keep those wings flapping, don’t miss a jump, and keep a lookout for cool powerups to keep you flying longer and higher!

Source: The Developer Website.

99291.name: Hungry MonstR
99291.description:
It's a tough job selling ice cream in MonstRland. Find out just how tough it can be in Hungry MonstR for your Android device. Test your reaction time and keep your wits about you--it's not easy keeping calm with a horde of MonstRs rushing for your ice cream. Feel the addictive rush as you defend your ice cream cart and defend your dessert.

Flick or drag the MonstRs into their matching colored tubes in the corners of the screen. You can get rainbow power-ups to drop by performing a double, or even triple rainbow move. Complete a full circle by flicking two of each colored MonstR into its matching tube without breaking the sequence. Double Rainbow can be started from any tube, going clockwise or counter-clockwise. Pick up various other power-ups to help multiply your score and make your way to the top of the leaderboards.

Source: The Publisher Website.

99292.name: Dungeons & Dragons: Daggerdale
99292.description:
Dungeons & Dragons Daggerdale centers on the desperate struggle to defeat the evil Rezlus and his Zhentarim in their attempt to invade and conquer the Dalelands. Players are charged with the task of restoring order to the Dalelands by unlocking the secrets of the Mines of Tethyamar, defeating the evil within the treacherous Tower of the Void, leading to the final confrontation with Rezlus himself.

The game is the first in a planned trilogy of video games.

Source: Wikipedia, "Dungeons & Dragons: Daggerdale," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

99293.name: Jr. Rangerland National Parks Board Game
99293.description:
Grab your binoculars and visit our National Parks. In this game of color matching and exploration, players collect Explorer Cards as they journey to National parks throughout the United States. They will experience many landmarks, buildings, and natural wonders while always on the lookout for plants, animals, items of interest and opportunities to care for the parks.

The Explorer Cards include many plants, animals, and geological features. There are also cards that provide opportunities for players to help out around the park or discover some important historical or cultural facts. There are 32 cards in all!

The winner of the game is the person who can gather the most Explorer cards.

As an extra challenge, players can look for matching plants and animals that show up on the Explorer cards. They are hidden on the game board.

No reading is required.

99294.name: Darkmoon's Curse
99294.description:
from the back of the book

Wanted! A new hero for a new world.

The one peaceful land of Karazan is deeply troubled. Its king lies dead, the victim of an Orcish arrow; the evil wizard Darkmoon has stolen the king's crown and now the heir to the throne, Prince Goldhawk, has been poisoned.

YOU have been called to this troubled land by Marris the court magician. Your tak is to return the king's crown to Castle Karazan. Orlando, the Tin Pig, is your only travelling companion. Edge, the Sword, is your only weapon. Many will try to stop you, some may help you. But no matter who, or what, stands in your way you must succeed.

99295.name: The Demon Spider
99295.description:
from the back of the book

Wanted! A new hero for a new world.

You have been called to the troubled land of Karazan to take on the role of Prince Goldhawk. Having successfully completed your first mission by defeating the evil wizard Darkmoon, the people of Karazan want you to be their King.

Should you accept the challenge, a mighty task lies ahead, Orcs and skeleton armies are closing in on Karazan Castle. Terror Bubbles are spreading fear amongst the Karazantian soldiers. One man holds the key to the Orcs' defeat: Stonehammer, the mighty man-mountain, but to find him you will first have to visit the dreaded Demon Spider.

99296.name: Villanía
99296.description:
Del Editor:

En un reino de maldad, un grupo de súpervillanos peleará entre si, codo a codo para destruir al mundo.

Porque lo único que podría detener a un súpervillano, es la envidia de otro súpervillano!

¡Divertido juego en el que podrás demostrar si es mejor ganar o hacer perder a los demás!"

From the Publisher:

In an evil kingdom a group of supervillains fight each other side by side to destroy the world.

The olnly thing that could stop a supervillain is the envy of other supervillains!!

Fun game where you can show whether it is better to win or make lose each other!

Each player represents a supervillain trying to build a machine to destroy the world. You collect the parts of the machine (represented by cards) and complete it before a rival destroy all your progress. There are several ways (cards) to destroy the progress of a player such as "Sabotage" and "theft " also we have defenses to each of these cards as "immunity " or "divine justice"

The sequence in which you build your machine is:

- 1 machine layout
- 1 Power Supply
- 3 different components
- 1 special component
- 4 final count cards (... 3 ... 2 ... 1 ... KABOOM)

The first player to blow up his or her machine is the winner.

99297.description:
This is a very small print & play expansion to Valdora found on Michael Schacht web site.
This special commission can be done with two golds and any other precious stone and works just like the other commissions.
99297.name: Valdora: Additional Commission

99298.description:
The Revised and Expanded edition of the 2006 book Ostfront.

A Flames of War sourcebook for mid-war conflicts on the Eastern Front. Includes a brief historical overview of the Eastern Front ca. 1942-1943, but is primarily composed of listings of organization/composition, special rules and point values for units within the German, Finnish, Hungarian, Italian, Romanian and Soviet forces participating in this theater.

Per design notes from the Flames of War website:
'Following from North Africa, Eastern Front is a major revamp of Ostfront, one of our mid-war compendia. Like North Africa it brings our old books up to our latest standards with the new company organisation diagrams, complete listings rather than modifications for variants, and better overall organisation. It has also undergone a comprehensive re-pointing to bring all of the forces into line and incorporate the last four years of experience.'
99298.name: Flames of War: Eastern Front

11168.name: Flames of War: The World War II Miniatures Game

rpg.318: Lord of the Rings Roleplaying Game

rpg.318: Lord of the Rings Roleplaying Game

99301.name: Pickup
99301.description:
A game of frantic energy as you grow a small startup courier business to become the best in the city.

The game is for 2-4 players aged 10+.

Players assume the role of CEO of a small courier company, each company can be setup in different ways so that players can maximize the differences they have with other players and exploit different business styles.

Players must quickly collect parcels in a turn that uses simultaneous play, a game for the quick of mind and quick of hand. The more successful you become the quicker you will need to become in seeing opportunity and taking it.

Balance this out with a few moments to plan and purchase ways to grow your business with improvements or expansions, building you business through various growth stages, each stage offering more choices and options to make you business more efficient and profitable.

To be released mid-2011.

rpg.318: Lord of the Rings Roleplaying Game
